title: The Federalist Papers
author: Alexander Hamilton, James Madison, John Jay
summary: A collection of essays written by Alexander Hamilton, James Madison, and John Jay, advocating for the ratification of the United States Constitution. The papers provide insights into the framers' intentions and constitutional principles.

title: Democracy in America
author: Alexis de Tocqueville
summary: Tocqueville's analysis of American society and political institutions in the 19th century. 'Democracy in America' explores the strengths and weaknesses of democratic governance and its impact on individuals and communities.
